content:
### EXISTING STRUCTURES

#### Iron Ore Mine at position (16.0, 71.0)
Consists of 
- Burner Mining Drill (position x=16.0, y=71.0)
- Chest (position x=15.5, y=69.5) to collect iron ore
- Burner Inserter (position x=14.5, y=69.5) to output iron ore from chest (currently facing down, pickup position x=14.5 y=68.5, drop position x=14.5 y=70.5)
- Burner Inserter (position x=16.5, y=69.5) to input iron ore into furnace (currently facing up, pickup position x=16.5 y=70.5, drop position x=16.5 y=68.5)
- BeltGroup (positions x=14.5 y=70.5, x=15.5 y=68.5, x=16.5 y=68.5, x=17.5 y=68.5, x=17.5 y=69.5, x=17.5 y=70.5, x=17.5 y=71.5, x=17.5 y=72.5, x=16.5 y=72.5, x=15.5 y=72.5, x=14.5 y=72.5) that connects the output inserter to the input inserter (inventory has iron ore)
- Furnace (position x=19.0, y=71.0) to smelt iron ore into iron plates
- Chest (position x=21.5, y=71.5) to collect iron plates
- Burner Inserter (position x=20.5, y=71.5) to output iron plates into chest (currently facing left, pickup position x=21.5 y=71.5, drop position x=19.5 y=71.5)
- Burner Inserter (position x=19.5, y=68.5) to transfer iron ore to furnace (currently facing left, pickup position x=20.5 y=68.5, drop position x=18.5 y=68.5)
- BeltGroup (positions x=19.5 y=69.5, x=21.5 y=68.5, x=21.5 y=69.5, x=20.5 y=69.5) that connects the furnace output inserter to the output chest
- BeltGroup (positions x=15.5 y=68.5, x=19.5 y=67.5) that connects the output inserter to the input inserter of furnace
- BeltGroup (positions x=20.5 y=69.5, x=21.5 y=68.5) that connects the furnace output inserter to the output chest
- BeltGroup (positions x=14.5 y=72.5, x=17.5 y=70.5) that connects the output inserter to the input inserter

### ERROR TIPS

* Errors when inserting items into furnaces without sufficient ingredients or when the furnace is not ready
  - Check if the furnace has sufficient ingredients and is ready to accept more items before attempting to insert
* Errors when inserters are not correctly oriented or are blocked
  - Check the direction of inserters to ensure they are correctly picking up and dropping off items
  - Clear any blockages that may be preventing inserters from functioning correctly
* Errors when transport belts are blocked or not properly connected
  - Clear any blockages on the transport belts to continue mining or processing
  - Ensure that transport belts are properly connected to compatible entities (e.g., inserters, other transport belts)
* Errors when attempting to insert items into entities that are not ready or are not compatible
  - Verify that the target entity is ready to accept items and is compatible with the item being inserted
* Errors when furnaces have no ingredients to smelt
  - Ensure that furnaces have sufficient ingredients to smelt before attempting to smelt
* All other error tips from the previous report remain relevant:
  - Ensure sufficient spacing between entities to avoid collisions
  - Use inserters to take items from source entities (e.g., chests, furnaces) before connecting to other entities
  - Check if a position is occupied before attempting to place an entity
  - Ensure that transport belts are connected to compatible entities (e.g., inserters, other transport belts)
  - Avoid connecting transport belts directly to chests or other entities that do not support direct belt connections
  - Ensure that 'return' statements are used within functions
  - Ensure that variables are defined before use
  - Verify that the position of the entity exists before attempting to retrieve it

### NAMESPACE
